results.title: Liebelei
results.brief_description: Vienna, 1910; a whirlwind love affair between Fritz, a young lieutenant in the Austro-Hungarian Army, and Christine, the shy and sensitive daughter of a musician, ends in tragedy. Ophuls freely adapted Schnitzler’s play in which Christine’s great love is just another affair for the dissolute lieutenant already involved with a baroness. In the film Fritz’s affair with the baroness has more or less ended and the couple’s expression of undying love (not entirely cynical on his part), is threatened by the baron’s vengefulness - the portrayal, in the play, of innocence destroyed by cynical players in a decadent society gives way to Ophuls’ atmospheric portrayal of love doomed by hollow class distinction and hidebound notions of honour. Cast includes Magda Schneider, Wolfgang Liebeneiner and Gustaf Grundgens. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Lie of the land
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Maps and Map Reading”.
Using the example of a company setting up a VHF radio network in rugged mountain country, the film examines the lines of sight, gradients and contour patterns. Produced for the State Emergency Service Tasmania.

results.title: Lickety-split licorice
results.creator_credit: Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions, Sterling Educational Films and Jan Steen
results.brief_description: A boy and girl making liquorice, stretch it outside in a tangled web which leads to utter chaos as people become entangled in it. When someone snips the gigantic piece of liquorice, the scenes flash rapidly backwards to reality. No spoken commentary - English intertitles.

results.title: Lichtenstein in London
results.brief_description: In February 1968, an exhibition of the paintings of the American pop artist Roy Liechtenstein was held at the Tate Gallery in London. This is a film record of the exhibition and both members of the public and Liechtenstein comment on the work displayed. The public were interviewed by Hugh Evans. Roy Liechtenstein’s comments were taken from interviews by Alan Soloman recorded for National Education Television and by David Sylvester recorded for British Broadcasting Corporation.

results.title: Lichfield: a symphony in stone
results.brief_description: A study of Lichfield Cathedral, famous for its three spires, the central one of which was ruined in the Civil War, but afterwards restored. Illistrates archetecture, constructional details, carving and statues of the Cathedral.

results.title: Licensed to drive (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Jeff regains his licence after losing it for drink-driving. He is determined to keep it this time and has to find ways of sticking to the zero limit. Eventually he is able to meet the challenge of going to a party and enjoying himself without alcohol. He can keep to his decision : “When I drink I don’t drive and when I drive I just don’t drink”.

results.title: Licence to kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The happy nuptials of James’ CIA buddy Felix Leiter (David Hedison) and bride-to-be Della are rudely interrupted when they embark on a mercy dash to capture drug lord Franz Sanchez (Robert Davi). Thanks to some aerial fishing though, their mission is successful and the parachuting groomsmen make it in time for the wedding. The happy couple are soon devastated however when Sanchez escapes and kills the bride and maims the groom as payback. This triggers best buddy James (Timothy Dalton) to relinquish his secret service status and licence to kill authority (Bond is under orders to complete another mission) as he embarks on a personal vendetta to revenge Sanchez’s brutality towards his friends. Ably assisted by ex-Army pilot Pam Bouvier (Carey Lowell), Bond flies into Isthmus City to infiltrate himself into Sanchez’s posse where he discovers a television evangelist (Wayne Newton) providing a front for cocaine dealing. Featuring a plethora of water inspired stunts earlier on in the film, the cast also includes Benicio Del Toro as a brooding henchman and Talisa Soto as Lupe Lamore, Sanchez’s mistress, eye candy, and source of jealousy for Bouvier. This was Timothy Dalton’s last appearance as Bond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq

results.title: Library organization
results.brief_description: Explains the card cataloguing system and the Dewey decimal system in use in one typical library and shows how more detailed understanding of library organisation speeds up work in the library and makes for better studying and better use of study time.
results.description: Explains the card cataloguing system and the Dewey decimal system in use in one typical library and shows how more detailed understanding of library organisation speeds up work in the library and makes for better studying and better use of study time.
